Title: Binding from Mihr and Mushtari
Medium: black leather with gold and red leather doublures
Description: This original binding from Walters manuscript W.627 is composed of black leather and has a flap. The binding has a gold-brushed central panel and doublures of red leather with filigree work.
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Book; Calligraphy; Codex; Colophon; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; Ornament; New Abbasid style; Iran; Literature -- Poetry
Provenance: Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown] [bookplate]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Iranian
